5.24. 
Acceptance of testamentary exclusivity
1. The beneficiary of a testamentary exclusive shall be entitled to accept the testamentary exclusive within three months from the date on which he knew or should have known that he was entitled to the testamentary exclusive.
2. The beneficiary shall notify the executor of the will (administrator of the estate), the heir who has accepted the estate and who is bound to execute the testamentary exclusion, or the notary of the place where the estate has arisen, of the acceptance of the testamentary exclusion. If the testamentary exception relates to a right over immovable property, the application shall in all cases be submitted to a notary. The notary shall issue a certificate of succession and the testamentary exclusion shall be registered in the public register.
